metadata.title: webpack: DOM Clobbering vulnerability in AutoPublicPathRuntimeModule (moderate)
metadata.description: DOCUMENTATION: A DOM Clobbering vulnerability was found in Webpack via `AutoPublicPathRuntimeModule`. DOM Clobbering is a type of code-reuse attack where the attacker first embeds a piece of non-script through seemingly benign HTML markups in the webpage, for example, through a post or comment, and leverages the gadgets (pieces of JS code) living in the existing javascript code to transform it into executable code. This vulnerability can lead to Cross-site scripting (XSS) on websites that include Webpack-generated files and allow users to inject certain scriptless HTML tags with improperly sanitized name or ID attributes.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
js-d3-flame-graph is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
